description.narrative: IFC's main role lies in facilitating the development of Kosovo's financial sector through introducing a subordinated loan in the form of Tier II capital. This would help diversify the funding base of the Bank and set as a benchmark for others to raise funding in the form of Tier II capital which is highly effective to increase lending as it leverages the balance sheet. Furthermore, by sharing IFC's global knowledge and expertise in the financial markets, IFC would help TEB Sh. A to strengthen its business strategy and implement best industry practices in a nascent market. The Project will generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products tailored to the SMEs.

TEB Sh. A became operational on Jan 2, 2008. The Bank operates through 18 branches employing 320 people with a market share of approximately 7% (4th ranking in Kosovo) with total assets and loans, respectively, amounting to around EUR130 million and EUR87 million as of March 2010.
Proposed investment, which would be used to support the growing loan portfolio towards medium and small enterprises, is a subordinated loan of up to EUR 7 million to the Bank to be counted towards its Tier II capital in line with local banking regulations. Proposed maturity is up to 10 years with a prepayment option after the first 5 years.
